Do not be a fool and settle for touristy spots around Las Ramblas.  Make your way to the historic, cobblestone side streets bit too far away and you will be rewarded with some of the best pintxos in town.  So, if you're a virgin when it comes to this delightful Catalan tradition, the bar is filled with different types of "pintxos" - or bite sized servings of everything from tortilla española or jamón iberico over a slice of delectable bread.  Order a "caña" (beer on tap) or a glass of wine and help yourself to what's already out on the bar, or exercise some patience and wait for the hot varieties that come out of the kitchen.  Croquettes filled with shrimp and spicy sausage called chistorra were some of our favorites.  Then at the end, the waitress will count the number of toothpicks you consumed as this would equal the number of pintxos you enjoyed.  But beware as your eyes might be bigger than your stomach!  After all, the idea is to have a few then move on to the next stop!
